meanings.definition: Briskly - in a quick and lively manner
meanings.sent1: She walked brisky to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel moved brisky through the trees.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they raced brisky to the playground.
meanings.sent4: Time flew by brisky as they enjoyed the sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The music played, urging everyone to dance brisky.

meanings.sent1: The brisk wind made her cheeks rosy.
meanings.sent2: A brisk shower woke him up in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The brisk walk in the park cleared her mind.
meanings.sent4: The brisk mountain air filled their lungs with energy.
meanings.sent5: The brisk dip in the cold lake was exhilarating.

meanings.definition: Brisk - keen or sharp in speech or manner
meanings.sent1: Her brisk tone indicated she was in a hurry.
meanings.sent2: He gave a brisk nod to show his agreement.
meanings.sent3: The brisk response caught him off guard.
meanings.sent4: The brisk debate left everyone impressed.
meanings.sent5: His brisk wit always kept the conversation lively.
